author: Baha'u'llah
source_text: عُوا عِبادَكَ عَنِ التَّوَجُّهِ إِلَيْكَ، أَيْ رَبِّ لَكَ الحَمْدُ عَلَى كُلِّ ذلِكَ أَسْئَلُكَ بِأَنْ تُوَفِّقَنِيْ وَأَحِبَّتِي لإِعْلآءِ كَلِمَتِكَ ثُمَّ أَثْبِتْنا عَلَى شَأْنٍ لا يَمْنَعُنا شَيْءٌ مِنْ مَكارِهِ الدُّنْيا وَشَدائِدِها عَنْ ذِكْرِكَ وَثَنائِكَ،
translation: For all these things I offer thanksgiving unto Thee, O my Lord! I implore Thee to assist me and them that love me to magnify Thy Word, and to endow us with such strength that the ills of this world and its tribulations will be powerless to hinder us from remembering Thee and from extolling Thy virtues. Powerful art Thou to do all things; resplendent art Thou above all things.
